bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names she bu neng yan 舌不能言 , the tongue cannot speak. Illness Sign of an inability to speak because the tongue cannot move. Xuan ming lun fang 宣明論方 2: 內奪而 厥，舌喑不能言，二足廢，不為用。腎脈虛弱，其氣厥不至，舌不仁。 經云：喑俳，足不履用，聲音不出者 , “In the case of internal deprivation with recession, the tongue is silent and one cannot speak. The two feet are lame and cannot be used. The [movement in the] kidney vessels is depleted and weak. Its qi has receded and fails to arrive. The tongue is numb. The Classic states: ‘mute and lame, the feet cannot be used for walking, and no sound is emitted ’”.
